intro: Calcitrapa schouwii, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in its native dry habitat. Calcitrapa schouwii is known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
